page.title: 03Cockerham Parish Council
page.content: Seven Councillors and a Clerk meet bi-monthly to administer its work for 550 members of the electorate.Since 1980,Council's achievements have resulted in street lighting and a parking area on the Marsh Lane Council Estate.Trees planted on the Church path and on westerly approach to the village.Implementation of a 30 mph speed restriction along Main Street in late 1984, after many attempts stretching over 20 years.Council Capital Grants have assisted the Parish Hall(the focal point of the area's social life)towards maintenance, ie fencing,new west wall,tiling,toilets and first phase of re-roofing.Grant aid also helped the Bowling Club renovate the Pavillion.To commemorate the Royal Wedding (29.7.81)each child in the Parish under 16 years received a Royal Crown.
